questions.question: What is the use of rectifier?

answers.a: To convert DC input voltage to AC output voltage.
answers.d: To convert AC input voltage to DC output voltage.

explanations.a: Explanation 1: A rectifier is used to convert AC into DC.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following devices is more suitable for forming an uncontrolled rectifier?

explanations.a: Explanation 1: A line frequency diode is most suitable for forming an uncontrolled rectifier.

questions.question: 3. The peak inverse voltage (PIV) of diodes in diode full bridge rectifier is equal to

answers.c: Peak value of AC input voltage

explanations.d: Explanation 4: It is the maximum voltage appearing across the diode when it is reverse biased.

questions.question: 4. Ripple factor of an uncontrolled rectifier with resistive load is?
5. Which of the following statements is correct for the RMS value of output voltage?

answers.a: V<sub>rms</sub> in an uncontrolled rectifier with resistive load is equal to the average of input AC voltage.
answers.b: V<sub>rms</sub> in an uncontrolled rectifier with resistive load is equal to the peak of AC input voltage.
answers.c: V<sub>rms</sub> in an uncontrolled rectifier with resistive load is equal to the average of output voltage.
answers.d: V<sub>rms</sub> in an uncontrolled rectifier with resistive load is equal to the rms of AC input voltage.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: In an uncontrolled rectifier with a resistive load, the RMS value of the output voltage is same as the RMS value of the AC input voltage.
